statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Boise State 54, Henderson State 52
article.story: BOISE, Idaho (AP) -- Jermaine Blackburn scored 17 points and Coby Karl added 12 as Boise State outlasted Henderson State 54-52 Saturday in the Boise State Invitational tournament. NCAA Division II Henderson State (1-4) had a chance to tie the game in the final 10 seconds, but two put-back attempts from under the basket by senior forward Tyrel Hightower went over the basket. Boise State of Division I Western Athletic Conference (2-0) was able to inbounds the ball and run out the final seven seconds. Henderson St., of Arkadelphia, Ark., pulled to within 54-52 with a 3-pointer by senior guard Tarvoris Uzoigwe with 1:18 left in the game. Uzoigwe was Henderson States leading scorer with 12 points and Omar Guinea added 11. Henderson State opened a 20-12 lead with eight minutes left in the first half based on an 11-6 rebounding edge and 50 percent shooting from the field. But Boise State rode the scoring of Blackburn to narrow the Reddies halftime lead to 28-27. Boise State took the lead for good 32-31 on a field goal by Karl with 16:39 left in the game. The Reddies out-rebounded Boise State 39-29 but doubled the Broncos in turnovers with 16.
